speaker: TAZ Transcript Episode 89 - Amnesty - Part Nine
Griffin
lines: Previously, on the Adventure Zone…

speaker: Barclay
lines: Moira, we need to get ourselves a magical, intangible weapon. I’m thinking it’s time our friends here met the Enchanter.

speaker: Moira
lines: I know you’re searching for answers about the origins of the magic that dwells within you. If you have the time you may find it prudent to inquire about your abilities while in Sylvane.

speaker: Vincent
lines: I understand, you need to see the Enchanter. And I must also insist that you make your introductions to the Interpreter as is custom for those who serve to protect Sylvane from the world beyond.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A massive shape lifts up from the darkness below you. It is an unthinkably gigantic gray anthropomorphic cat, and it says,

speaker: Cat
lines: The people of this world know me as the Enchanter. You may call me by my name. I… am Heathcliff. [others laugh]

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: So the three of you are standing in front of a chasm underneath this city. The air is still, there’s just this sound of water dripping from the catacombs behind you and the purring of this enormous gray cat with a white patch of fur on its gargantuan belly in front of you. And Heathcliff says,

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I prefer to keep my dealings clean and concise, but I can assume that with your current knowledge of Sylvane being what it is, that would be quite impossible, so, I have what you need and you have what I want, and I do not want this interaction to be interrupted by your ceaseless questions—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Fluffy!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Yes, much like that, so maybe we could get through this quickly—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Fluffyyy!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Before we move on yes, I’m a gigantic cat. No, you may not pet me. You may not pet me.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Who’s a good kitty?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: No, you may not pet me. I just met you. Any other questions before we start?

speaker: Duck
lines: I have one sort of query that ends in an interrobang A talking cat?!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Yeah. Get used to it, mister, I’m breaking all the rules over here— I talk, yes; I’m the size of a moderately-sized building, yes, that too— I defy expectations in so many ways, but you’ve decided to settle on my power of speech, so that’s sort of your bag.

speaker: Duck
lines: So, what’re you doing down here?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Well, I’m a little too big to fit anywhere topside, aren’t I?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, that’s a fun kind of way of dodging my question. What do you do?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I find myself surrounded down here by the light of Sylvane in its purest, rawest, most potent form, and so I spend most of my time down here tinkering around with that power. That’s why they call me the enchanter, you see, and that is what has brought you to me today. I assume you seek my services to empower one of your pieces of equipment or perhaps generate a new one for you, as the case may be. I’m assuming that the three of you are human, based on the fact that you do not have fur or fangs or— you are not spectral or see-through in any way and thus therefore are hunting monsters on the other side. I know a little bit about the way of world, so I assume that’s the situation. I assume you seek the same arrangement that I have maintained with the other members of the Pine Guard.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, I don’t mean to give you notes, but is it too late to make Heathcliff speak in rhyme?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Clint
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Travis
lines: ‘Cause it really feels like…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmm…

speaker: Travis
lines: It really feels like it would take it over the top for me…

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I will do you something magic, in a way that—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I’m not gonna do that, it’s—

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, but if you see the opportunity for it, will you take it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I will take it, I promise.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, like, more rhymes than the average person.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, yes, yes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: [high-pitched voice] What about a riddle?

speaker: Travis
lines: Ooh! I’ll take a riddle!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Any other questions before we move on? Again, I do not wanna be interrupted.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: So…

speaker: Travis
lines: I have to remember, it’s been so long…

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s been a month.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: So, do we just, like, ask you for stuff? And you, like, give it to us?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I mean, I’m not a mindreader, I’m a cat!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, we’ll say it out loud, like, I would say “I would like a magic wand!” and you would be like “Yeah!” and hand me one?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I wouldn’t hand you one, I’d generate you one from the Ether, summoning it from the blackest depths of Sylvane, but yeah, that could be how the arrangement works. You ask, and I shall provide.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I got a request. Do you do exchanges?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I’m curious to hear what you think would satisfy my mysterious needs.

speaker: Duck
lines: Trade ‘em ups? I got this sword, and I would love to trade it for… anything? A nice whip? And when I say a nice whip, I mean a good quality one, but also one that is of a gentle, caring spirit. Y’know, just a nice, kind whip—

speaker: Travis
lines: “Supportive…”

speaker: Duck
lines: Supportive… won’t be, like, sort of picking at me… constantly. If you have anything, I would love to trade you, and I can kick in… um…

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I have no need for—

speaker: Duck
lines: Hey, that’s Earth money, cousin! All right?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I’m not familiar with what the exchange rate stands at right now, [Duck It’s good.] but I won’t be needing that. I am curious about the sword, though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And he extends his gigantic furry paw, and places it on the ledge that the three of you are standing on and says—

speaker: Duck
lines: Ah, shit!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Oh, I’m not— don’t worry, I’m… declawed. Do you mind if I examine your blade?

speaker: Beacon
lines: Oh, Duck Newton, this is adorable. A lover’s quarrel, eh, Duck?

speaker: Duck
lines: Shut up, Beacon. Jesus Christ. Here, this is the sword, please, anything you got! Here!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hand the sword over to Heathcliff, who raises his paw up to his face and examines it for a moment. He actually takes out a little eyeglass, like a little jeweler’s eyeglass, and examines it very very closely. And he smiles and hands it back to you and he says,

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: This weapon is quite curious! Sorry, what was your name?

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I’m Duck Newton, it’s a nickname. I’m on the Forestry Service for the Monongahela State Forest, and also, I guess… the Pine Guard.

speaker: Travis
lines: Have we ever learned Duck’s real name?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think so. That’s finale material.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, ‘cause I would like to pitch Ruchard?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ruchard is— Justin, simmer on that, okay?

speaker: Travis
lines: ‘Cause, it’s like how Dick is short for Richard, and Duck is short for Ruchard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, that’s quite good, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: This weapon is indeed, uh… it is imbued with magic, but it is not our magic. This is a curious artifact, Earthling. I would be happy to take it off your hands, provided your ask is fair.

speaker: Duck
lines: Whaddaya mean?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: What would you require from me for— in exchange? Other than— would a really good whip really do it?

speaker: Duck
lines: Like a NI— I mean it would have to be a choice— aw man. Yeah. I’m losing my nerve… ‘cause Minerva— Oooh! [Clint Oooh!] Unintentional, but um. Minerva gave it to me and I figure she probably had her reasons. I was acting impulsively, [Travis laughs] Heathcliff, I apologize.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Hmm. Okay.

speaker: Ned
lines: And all you need is Minerva to come here, see it hanging on the wall, all of a sudden there’s bad juju with you guys— Yeah, you don’t want that.

speaker: Duck
lines: Right. “Hey, Duck, I’d love to see your great sword. Can you show it to me real quick.” And I do a thing where I’m like “Yeah, it’s in the bathroom, hold on let me go get it.” And then she would go to the bathroom and the window’d be open and I’d be trucking it down the street. Oh call me [inaudible] slamming door farce, we used to call me in college. So, anyway, I’m sorry. I’ve wasted a lot of your time, giant cat, and I’m real sorry about it.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: It’s quite all right. I’m deeply curious about your blade, maybe someday we can find an arrangement—

speaker: Duck
lines: I would think you’d be extra careful with being curious there, I’d imagine that goes triple for a kitty of your size, eh?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Yeah, that is a good point. I do not have many opportunities to be curious down here in the—

speaker: Duck
lines: Probably safer.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Yes, quite. So, you mentioned an elemental you seek to slay and I do not know of this elemental of which you speak but if you need to destroy something intangible, it would make sense that you require a weapon that can attack intangibly. This is kitten’s play. You there, the old one. [Ned Hmm?] I see there you have a primitive Earth revolver, it is a thing of complete ugliness, but I can give it an arcane makeover the likes of which you’ve never seen if you wish.

speaker: Ned
lines: Well, first of all, let me explain. This gun was once owned by Eliot Ness, the famous G-Man and I borrowed it from, uh, a museum. But this is quite a collector’s piece, so what are you suggesting?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I magic it up, my man. I do some magic on it. Unless you have something else you’d like me to enchant?

speaker: Ned
lines: [nervous hum] Now, what’s all this going to cost us?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I sense upon you an item I have desired for quite some time. The earrings once belonging to Moira. I have admired these pendulous beauties for many years before her exile from this place, a subject I am not at liberty to go on about.

speaker: Ned
lines: I’m not exactly sure I know what you’re talking about.

speaker: Duck
lines: We’ll trade you the earrings. That’s fine.

speaker: Ned
lines: Well, Duck! I don’t— Duck! Duck! [crosstalk]

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Hold on! We’ll trade you one earring for that.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I’ll make you a deal You hand me over Moira’s earrings, which I have not seen since she was exiled and I could not possibly— Dish the goss [gossip] on this one, do not press me on it. I hate the goss, and I think it is disgusting—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Can I stop you right there? [Heathcliff Yes] It kind of sounds like you want to dish the goss.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: I would never dish the goss. [crosstalk] I would never dish the goss.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Ohhh, Heathcliff.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Tell you what, you hand me over both earrings, I will count them as two gifts to me and therefore will increase the potency of the magicks I imbue your tools with.

speaker: Ned
lines: What do you guys think?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Does Ned get one, and I get one, and Duck gets one, or what’s the deal here?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Oh, there’s no need for me to be that prudent, I’m just chock-a-block full of magic so each of you will receive a gift.

speaker: Duck
lines: Oh, hell yeah. Do it, give him the earrings. What do we care?  We didn’t even know about him forty-five minutes ago.

speaker: Ned
lines: All right, how about—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: He makes an excellent point.

speaker: Ned
lines: All right! Here, here, earrings! Here there are! They are really lustrous, so try not to schmooze them up with your cat fur.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: No need to be mean.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So I have devised a sort of new way of doing the Fantasy Costco item acquisition stuff for Monster of the Week. Which I kinda had to do because it is not nearly an item-rich game as D&D was, right? And D&D could just be like “Oh, you found a more powerful sword and you found a ring that can freeze time or, y’know, whatever.” And that’s not really how Monster of the Week operates so instead, [Roll20 image send sound] I came up with a new rule. Oh Jesus Christ, this is [Clint Hmm...] this did not come out—

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, hold on, can you share it as a doc with us, perhaps?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. How this is going to work. In the future, at the beginning of each new sort of arc here in Amnesty, the three of you will receive a letter from Heathcliff. And that letter will contain a hit-list of three Earth items that he wants. And all three of them will be available at some point during your hunt, but it will often require you to put yourself in harm’s way or a risky situation or something to acquire them.

speaker: These will be kind of like sidequests, so I’m not intending you to just be like “Okay, well I’m going to the— Y’know, I’m gonna rob a bank or something so I can get the magic diamond that he needs.” They will be sort of organically in— I will find a way to work these organically into the hunt, it’s just up to you whether or not you want to like take the risk to get them.

So that adds sort of a natural complication to things. Every item that you bring back to him, you will gain +1 on a roll that you do when you visit Heathcliff. So, for instance, if you recover all three items you would roll 2d6+3 when doing this Acquisition roll.

And then, from there, you can either enchant a piece of gear that you already have and make it better. Or you can summon a new piece of gear which won’t be as dope as the pre-existing piece of gear that you already had, that you enchanted, but it will still be a new thing that you can use. And that works with Gear Tags which is a mechanic in Monster of the Week, which your gear already has, like
lines: one harm, two harm, area. I think Beacon attacks in an area, that’s a tag, fire is a tag.

speaker: All the tags are sort of— they inform the narrative, they inform what these pieces of gear can do. So on a really good roll you tell Heathcliff, “Oh, I want my sword to have fire on it,” and then you roll and if you roll well then it has it, if you roll a seven to nine you get that tag but you also get a “bad tag” that will complicate that weapon.

If you fail, it gives me narrative tools to use against you. And then if you fail completely, rather than just doing the normal, “You fail and you get one XP,” because this is sort of a high-stakes roll, if you fail this one you actually get two XP, so you still, like, get a nice little boost even if you fuck up. But basically, the more items you recover off Heathcliff’s hit-list, the better chance you have to get a better item. Does that make sense?
Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Justin
lines: Yep!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, those are the rules, Ned, do you want to start?

speaker: Ned
lines: Absolutely! I believe I would like you to enchant something I already have.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Okay, let’s have it then.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: His butt!

speaker: Ned
lines: Well—

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: You want an ench— I think it's already quite enchanting!

speaker: Ned
lines: Than— [Aubrey Awwww…] Well, thanks? Um, when we discovered we were dealing with something mostly made of water I thought of this item, which I obtained a number of years ago from a man named Reyn Guyer. He's the man who invented—

speaker: Clint
lines: And I open up my coat.

speaker: Ned
lines: —the NERF gun. And I want you to enchant this NERF gun that I acquired. It's a very historical piece, very, very sought after. And I thought, perhaps, you could enchant this NERF because, hey, what better against something that's made of water than NERF darts.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: [sarcastic] Yeah, can’t fault your logic there. Uh, that completely [Duck I can.] holds up to— no, it holds up completely to any level of scrutiny or logic. You want me to enchant your NERF gun, and not your gun gun?

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah! The gun gun doesn't do shit against water things.

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: [sarcastic] No, it needs NERF, no, definitely [crosstalk] the power of NERF.

speaker: Ned
lines: [crosstalk] And it has to have NERF. So, maybe—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Well, if it ain't NERF…

speaker: Ned
lines: It's nothin’!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Exactly!

speaker: Ned
lines: Maybe it could shoot harder, maybe? Uhh, maybe—

speaker: Duck
lines: Like a really hard-hitting NERF [Ned Yeah!] Blaster.

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Or you could just put a push-pin in it— In the darts. That really hurts, y’know what I mean?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Yeah. You were a nasty kid, huh?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [proudly] Yep!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Okay, I love this. I've enchanted so many things, nobody has thought to bring me a NERF gun, [Ned Thank you.] um, for obvious reasons. I could give it a magical enchantment that could turn it into the weapon that you desire. Um—

speaker: Ned
lines: Awesome!

lines: Hand it right over.

lines: And he extends his paw.

lines: Here ya go!

lines: [crosstalk] Woah…

lines: A NARF Blaster!

lines: It’s BERF! [Travis laughs] Um..

lines: NERPH. N-E-R-P-H. [Laughs]

lines: “It’s BERF or Bothin’!”

lines: All right, let’s enchant this thing. So, because you [Justin laughs] handed over what counted as two individual earrings, it'll be plus two on this Acquisition roll.

speaker: Justin
lines: [gasp] The enchantment, it's changing the branding! [Clint laughs] It’s unlicensed! It's ready for sale! “It’s BERF or Bothin’”!

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooohh…

lines: Okay, I think the tag that works here is “magic” if you want this thing to hurt this water monster. Okay, so he takes your NERF Blaster, your BAR— your BERF [Clint BERF.] Blaster, and descends— I think I like NARF way better, actually. He takes your NARF Blaster and descends down into the depths, and he’s down there for a few moments and there is a gust of wind and a blast of light from down in the depths that shoots forward to the ceiling of this chamber. And you hear this loud screeching meow from down there and then Heathcliff comes back up and he hands you back your enchanted NARF Blaster.

speaker: Uh, the barrel where the shotgun, I guess, balls were previously stored is now this cylinder of what looks like blue stone that is, like, crackling with energy, and it's vaguely in the shape of the chamber that was in there but now it is this sort of magical power device, uh, in the center of your NARF Blaster. And, uh, now it possesses the tag “magic”. Go ahead and— what is your— I think your revolver does two harm. I think this, just to keep it consistent, is a two harm magic [Clint
lines: Umm...] NARF Blaster.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it “close”? ‘Cus “close” is another tag on the .38, but—

lines: No, I think this would be whatever the next one is up from “close”, I think—

lines: Medium, yeah. I’ll figure out the exact word later.

lines: Okay, cool.

lines: I love it!

lines: He says,

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: Okay, that one was tricky because it was a toy for a baby, but, um—

lines: [offended] Woah! NARF is for big kids!

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: You're right, sorry, it's a big kid toy. Um, do either of you— the rest of you have something you would like?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yes, Mr. Heathcliff.

speaker: Travis
lines: And, i’m gonna be honest with y’all, I just raised my hand sitting here. Me, Travis. [Clint laughs] What’s the matter with me? Yeah, I don’t—  okay.

lines: I have kept running into a problem with this elemental. I can do fire magic really good and fire magic doesn't seem to be hurting this water thing. I would like to do ice, please.

lines: Now, wait just a moment. You're an earthling, right?

lines: He eyes you over. He actually lowers his huge face right next to you, and I think you get a better sense of his scale at this point, because his head alone is, like, three times your height. And he leans back and he says,

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: [puzzled] You are full of Sylvane’s power.

lines: I had a big meal when I got here?

speaker: Heathcliff
lines: No, that’s— I don’t know how you were so infused if you were born on Earth, but that… that is what I see, I can see it as plain as the stars in the sky. Well, if we were above ground, I mean. [Aubrey Uh-huh.] I can see it as plain as that guy’s hat. I see, though, you want ice magic. Hm. I’m afraid my mastery of the elements is somewhat limited; ironically, I, too, can work in fire. Ice is a little bit above my pay grade. I apologize for the shortcoming, if you have another idea in mind, I can see what I can do.

lines: Okay. I draw a lot of attention with my magic? Anything that would, like, protect me would be great? For when things inevitably get pissed.

lines: Hmm. I tell you what I can do. I can provide you a limited amount of stealth if you so desire, to one of your garments.

lines: I can make that happen. Lemme see what I can do.

He rises back from the depths after the same sort of flash and meow, the whole production, and he hands you your sleeveless jacket. And as he opens up his palm, you see that— what is it made out of? lines: No, I detect an unrelenting impatience that dwells within you. It makes sense now that fire is the element that has answered your call. Fire is foolhardy, it is impulsive, it is a force of blind destruction. You treat it as a weapon and it behaves as such. Consider this until next we meet, Aubrey Little, you cannot speak to the other elements because you do not know their language. You will be unable to harness all of the elements until you stop thinking of them as primitive weapons and instead treat them as they truly are, as blessings from a cosmic force beyond your current comprehension. I look forward to our first lesson.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then she reaches into her pocket and she pulls out what appears to be a small pocket watch, which she looks over, and says

speaker: Janelle
lines: Three minutes and 51 seconds. I'll have to make this up tonight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then she reaches under her pedestal and retrieves another gigantic book, which she cracks open and dives right back into.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: O-Okay…?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Woodbridge says, uh

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: Do you have anything else? We already sort of did the big meeting with the Interpreter, so… if you—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Who is that, by the way?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: The Interpreter is, um, something of a leader of our community. She literally interprets the will of Sylvain by speaking to it and understanding its—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Like the stone?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: The stone is but a part of Sylvain. Sylvain is the planet upon which we all stand.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: But she can speak to the stone?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: She can speak to the planet!

speaker: Duck
lines: She seemed kinda disinterested. Is that fair to say?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: I do not think it's appropriate to comment on her demeanor. Her job here is impossible for any other person alive to do, so I would not hold her exhaustion against her, Duck.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Is she actually a teenager, or is this one of those Narnia things?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: She is young, yes, she is fairly new to the role that has been placed upon her shoulders. It is not one of these Narnia things.

speaker: Duck
lines: [scoff] Can we go back yet?

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: Yeah, I wish you would, it would be great!

speaker: Duck
lines: Excellent, ‘cause I feel like we're about as well-equipped to do what we need to do.

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: Yeah, is that a jet pack? What's going on there?

speaker: Duck
lines: Please be careful with it. It honestly scares the shit out of me. I don't even really like carrying it, I'm really getting pretty stoked about taking it home. I'm half-tempted to leave it on the ground as we go back to our world, but I figure I'll hold on to it. If nothing else, I can chuck it at something and try to blow it up. [crosstalk] It’s called the Fly Master.

speaker: Woodbridge
lines: [crosstalk] Um— uh, rad name. Please do go, though. That would be fantastic for me, and for— you know, everyone.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah, I guess we’ll go, and I’ll think about my magic as a gift from the cosmos...

speaker: Griffin
lines: The guards by the door pound their spears down again and it opens, and the three of you head back out to the entrance hall, and moments later you are met by Vincent who seems winded after running all the way down here to meet you. And he walks with you back through the city to the archway, back to Kepler, and he nods to the squirrel-headed guard, who catches the moonlight on their shield, and shines it on the gate, which fills with light, and Vincent says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Uh, you all did fairl— you know what? It actually didn’t go the best, because you did almost explode one of the ministers, which I— to be fair to you, I didn’t say you shouldn’t do, but I thought it maybe would have been assumed that you shouldn’t try to blow up? One of the people you are meeting with? But it seemed like she was okay with it, so, I would say five outta ten.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I’ll take it!

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah, that’s not bad for us!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Um, one thing before you go. Have any of you seen any good movies lately? [Aubrey Hmm?] [Duck Sorry?] I know it’s not really part of the gig, I just, I’m fascinated by your world’s pop culture, it’s— it’s not important, I just thought if you had any recommendations, or reviews, or— Mama used to smuggle me in some DVDs from time to time.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Have you seen Black Panther yet?

speaker: Vincent
lines: I have not, it is— is that one out on one of your DVDs?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Not yet, but when it is? I’ll get ya a copy, it’s— oh.

speaker: Ned
lines: Does the name Tommy Wiseau mean anything to you?

speaker: Vincent
lines: He’s from our world.

speaker: Justin
lines: There it is. [crosstalk, not sure about this bit] That’s not— at all—

speaker: Vincent
lines: [crosstalk] Yes, I hear that’s something of a mystery in your world, uh, where he originates from, and I can go ahead and put that to bed, he is a mummy man. So, yes, I’m very familiar with him, quite a scoundrel, that one.

speaker: Duck
lines: Listen, this is— at what point I—

speaker: Vincent
lines: You’re right, the mons— the monster, it’s so much more important than, like, my hobby or whatever, so…

speaker: Ned
lines: Well we can bring you, we’ll bring ya something, we’ll hit Redbox, and make you a bunch.

speaker: Vincent
lines: Ok, that sounds perfect. Ok, good luck!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Ok bye!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the three of you step through the archway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ned, it is Saturday night— late Saturday night, and that means it's time for your big television debut for “Saturday Night Dead,” the television show that you do because you said you did it, like, three episodes ago. You're back at the Cryptonomica, it is after everything else that transpired today. By the way, this whole arc so far has just been one very wild day that you all have had, and now you're coming down off the end of it. And you're back at the Cryptonomica about to do a quick television show. Can you give a little bit of flavor for “Saturday Night Dead”? What's the vibe you're going for here?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, uh, I don't wanna go full on old-school horror movie night. We're using cameras in the Cryptonomica and, because of that, it's kind of a natural setting, but it'll be sorta like a, uh, Night Gallery feel. Maybe I'm standing in front of the case with, uh, George Washington's upper plate or, y'know, I'm standing in front of the case with Blackbeard’s treasure or something, so it's always visually very different, very atmospheric.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you dressed up like the Cryptkeeper or is it just sorta [crosstalk] Ned giving you full Ned.

speaker: Clint
lines: No! No, I don't want it to be quite that hokey, but Ned is a very stylish dresser, y’know. He's got the long scarf and he's got the clicks and the weskit. Y’know, he's dressed for it. I mean, he wants to put on a good show.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, I think there's a couple folks from the TV station, which is only one of, like, a very small handful that services, like, a pretty large area, since you all are in the Radio Quiet Zone. They're just sort of operating the lights. There's probably a camera person there. And then you have Kirby with a headset on, I think, helping out with just, sort of, some stage management— [matter-of-factly] uh, that's what they call it for television shows. [Travis Yep.] And he slides the headset off and walks over to you and he's like

speaker: Kirby
lines: Ned, man, I gotta tell you, I'm pretty nervous. This is— um, I feel like we didn't rehearse this at all. In fact, I kinda thought we had a dress rehearsal scheduled for earlier in the day, but then you weren't here at all today and so I just think that maybe this has a good chance at being a big disaster.

speaker: Ned
lines: I missed that, I'm sorry. I should have checked my Google calendar, but it'll be fine! Listen, this is all about energy, Kirby. This is all about bringing a spontaneity and a excitement to a— it's a live show, a live program beaming into literally tens of people's homes! Let's use that nervousness, use that fear, that energy to create something amazing!

speaker: Kirby
lines: Yeah, I mean, that's all gonna be on you. I think it's gonna go quite bad, but, um, good luck. We're on in five! Four! I'm doing the thing with my hand! Thr— two! I can't tal— [quietly] one! Go.

speaker: Ned
lines: Welcome my friends! This is Saturday Night Deeead! Live, or, I should say, dead [maniacal laugh] from the Cryptonomica! I am your host, Ned Superstar Chicane, and I welcome you to this palace of the bizarre, this home for humbuggery. This is the place where you can surrender yourself for the next two hours to enjoy one of the finest science fiction-horror movies ever made, set here in the fabulous Cryptonomica. Our movie tonight is Beast with a Thousand Eyes, so tonight we are going to take you through this movie and also let you come to know some of the amazing things we have here at the Cryptonomica, located just off Route 61155, all you have to do is come down and see us. We're open eight hours a day, five days a week, three hundred and forty-two days a year. And we're there to serve all of your bizarre, weird needs when it comes to the macabre. So, shall we begin!

speaker: Kirby
lines: Ye— yes!

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeahhh?

speaker: Kirby
lines: I don't know if we're supposed to talk. Yeah, go for it.

speaker: Ned
lines: I am so excited to have with me here joining me on stage, on scene. I would like my two friends, Duck Newton, to come out, also the magical, mystical Lady Flame. Come out here and take a bow you two!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay!

speaker: Ned
lines: Duck. C’mon, Duck. [Duck Yeah…] C'mon, just for a minute. Just c'mon.

speaker: Duck
lines: [Unenthusiastic] Hey everybody.

speaker: Ned
lines: This is the amazing Lady Flame. Do a trick!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh! Um…

speaker: Ned
lines: Do some of- don't burn anything down but do a little magic~, why don't you?

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, it’s going to be a really, like, fairly cool sleight of hand, especially with a camera, “Is this your card?” kind of thing. Oh, but at first it's one of those tricks where it's like, “Oh, it seems like she got it wrong,” right, and she's like, “Oh, yeah you’re right,” and then she opens up her jacket and there's a patch of, like, y'know, the three of clubs sewn into the inside. And she's like

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, was this it?

speaker: Ned
lines: Ohohohoho, amazing! Magic like that is a common occurrence here at the Cryptonomica, State Route 16055. Come down and see us. Now, Duck, show them your talking sword trick.

speaker: Duck
lines: I don't know what you're talking about, you asked me to come out here and give an announcement about forest safety and I am happy to remind everybody that, after you finish having fun out in the forest, it's great to dump water on your fire. Everybody knows that one, but do give it a good stir around once you dump the water on because sometimes there can be small embers that won't be extinguished, so it is important that you sorta create a dirt slurry. Anyway, yep. So, stay safe out there.

speaker: Ned
lines: ..Thank- thank you, Duck. And now you know. And knowing is half the battle! Now you've meet some of the folks here responsible for our fabulous show. Let's get right to some of the thrills and chills. Starring Paul Birch, Lorna Thayer, and Dona Cole, this is The Beast with a Thousand Eyes…

speaker: Kirby
lines: A Mil- A Million Eyes!

speaker: Ned
lines: What?

speaker: Kirby
lines: It’s a Million Eyes.

speaker: Ned
lines: That's what I said. Beast with a Million Eyes!

speaker: Kirby
lines: You said a thousand- it’s fine. [Shouting] Start the movie!

speaker: Griffin
lines: We see a prison two counties away. We see a common area. We see a pair of guards watching a small assembly of prisoners who are all seated in front of a small television. And one of the prisoners is holding the remote and flipping through the channels trying to find something for the group to watch. And they flip through some home shopping stuff, they flip through a couple infomercials, Adult Swim, probably. They flip through Saturday Night Live, just scoot right on past that. They flip past Saturday Night Dead, leaving it- lingering on the channel for just a few moments before changing it to another home shopping network special. And a prisoner seated a couple rows back walks up and puts his hand on the prisoner holding the remote. And this prisoner says

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Prisoner
lines: [Cockney accent] Would you do me a favor and flip back the channel for me?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the other prisoner does and this man laughs and he points at Ned on the television screen and he says

speaker: Prisoner
lines: Heh… I know that bloke.
